content: materials get all the yarn you ll need to make your own bobble sheep pillow with our yarn for bobble sheep pillow kit 1 it includes… - main yarn 10 skeins of purl soho s gentle giant 2 100% merino wool each skein is 48 yards/ 125 grams approximately 480 yards required we used heirloom white and graphite gray - contrast yarn 1 skein of purl soho s flax down 3 43% baby alpaca 42% merino wool 15% linen in kettle black each skein is 217 yards/ 100 grams approximately 159 yards required note the original color of the contrast yarn has been discontinued we ve replaced it with the slightly darker kettle black still flax down the photo of the finished bobble sheep here shows the original toasted charcoal color but the yarn photo above shows the updated kettle black baa you will also need - us 17 12 mm 32-inch circular needles 4 - optional us 17 24-inch circular needles when you start the body of the sheep you may find it more comfortable to use 24-inch circular needles than the double pointed needles you will still need the double pointed needles to work the tail though - set of us 17 double pointed needles 5 - set of us 10 6 mm double pointed needles - one 12-ounce bag of fairfield s poly-fil stuffing 6 - scrap yarn jumbo weight and crochet hook 7 to match for provisional cast on gauge - 8 stitches = 4 inches in garter stitch with main yarn on larger needles - 15 stitches = 4 inches in stockinette stitch with contrast yarn doubled on smaller needles size 28 inches long from chest to rear x 15 inches tall from top of back to bottom of belly 1 https //www purlsoho com/bobble-sheep-pillow-bundle html 2 https //www purlsoho com/gentle-giant html 3 https //www purlsoho com/flax-down html 4 https //www purlsoho com/tools/knitting-needles html type_filter=881 5 https //www purlsoho com/tools/knitting-needles html type_filter=888 6 https //www purlsoho com/poly-fil-stuffing html 7 https //www purlsoho com/tools/crochet-hooks html
